page.title: 13Keyham and Beeby Survey
page.content: A small survey of the residents of {Keyham}and{Beeby}was undertaken by children of Class 7 Humberstone Junior School during June 1985. The children aimed to find out some information about the residents of the villages. For a{minor purchase}most people travelled to{Scraptoft, Thurmaston}or {Leicester. Leicester}was the obvious choice for a{major purchase. Car was the universal method of transport, and the{lack of public transport}was mentioned by everyone. It seems that most people in the two villages had moved there from a local village. {Peace and quiet,}the{countryside}or a {change of job}were the reasons for their move, nevertheless many people felt{isolated.}In their spare time people enjoyed{gardening, walking}and {keep-fit.}They were worried about the proposed{Hamilton development.
